pros: Kind co-workers and work environment is positive.
cons: None, this is a great place to work.

job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in Due West, SC
pros: Being an SI has been extremely beneficial since graduating. It is a great way to build your resume and gain leadership skills.
cons: Minimum wage pay. This should increase for those who dedicate multiple years to SI

review_title: Overall A Solid Place To Work
job_title: Social Media Manager in Greenwood, SC
pros:
Faith-based organization. 
2 weeks PTO in addition to 2 weeks PTO at Christmas
cons:
Many process issues created unnecessary strain, and communication between departments was sparse. 

There was no opportunity for growth, which is to be expected at a small institution. 

I was exiting as a new president was entering so I could not speak about the current situation.

review_title: Christ-centered, beautiful campus, freedom to teach
pros: The opportunity to be part of a nationally ranked Christian liberal arts college that is making a difference in the lives of others.
cons: Small academic village is quaint but a good drive for Starbucks!

pros: Good education, good people, Christian, small and relationship oriented
cons: A little strict but they are a private institution

job_title: Financial Aid Counselor in Washington, DC
cons: They do not treat you like human beings, will use benefits as leverage over you, they do not pay comparable wages or offer comparable benefits to any other position like this one, they continually shame you for personal life decisions, they consistently force you to work overtime, make sure you are not able to have a work/life balance.

job_title: Admissions Operations in Due West, SC
pros:
This company really  values the whole person, not just the employee. Every level of leadership works closely with, and takes care of their team members.
Surrounded by a beautiful college campus.
Quiet offices so you can get work done, most with a beautiful view.
Fun activities with the staff.
A great place to grow and advance your career, especially a great place to get started in a professional career in higher education or any related field.
A fantastic and very safe community to live in and raise a family.
cons: The small community is about 20 minutes away from a bigger town, so a bit of driving is required, but this isn't generally a deal breaker.

review_title: Unique Liberal Arts College, Providing Great Experience to Students
job_title: Associate Professor in Due West, SC
pros: The atmosphere on campus is relaxed. There is normally no high stress level at work. Majority of the students are motivated and respectful. Practically,  there are no problematic students. All faculty and staff are dedicated and supportive to one another and to students. Relaxed atmosphere, low stress level at work.
cons: Rural environment, there is not much to do. Low compensation. No funds for research. Limited support for travel and career development.

job_title: Resident Assistant in Due West, SC
pros: They increased the salary and finally changed the job title from SLA. Most people in student services are nice on a surface level.
cons: Sometimes the student services department can be really frustrating. They have a lot of unnecessary meetings and several policies that are just plain dumb

job_title: Lobby Monitor in Due West, SC
cons: No cons to provide. It's a one day or two day a week job.

job_title: SI Instructor in Due West, SC
cons: Students are not intelligent and expect to be given answers

job_title: Student Government in Due West, SC
cons: Small town has pros and cons
